graph.packing

Class DBBNode0

  • java.lang.Object
    • graph.packing.DBBNodeBase
      • graph.packing.DBBNode0
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable, TaskObject

    class DBBNode0
extends DBBNodeBase
    represents a node in the distributed B & B tree of the hybrid B & B - GASP scheme for the 1-packing problem (max weighted independent set problem with non-negative node weights), using bit-vectors as implemented in the class popt4jlib.BoolVector to represent the node-ids of the partial solution it contains. Not part of the public API.

    Title: popt4jlib

    Description: A Parallel Meta-Heuristic Optimization Library in Java

    Copyright: Copyright (c) 2011-2017

    Company:

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Ioannis T. Christou

      • _nscomtor

        private static NodeSetWeightComparatorBV _nscomtor
        comparator between node-sets used in sorting node-sets in the getBestNodeSets2Add() method if the appropriate option in the parameters of the calling program is set. This sorting only makes sense when children DBBNode0 objects will be "cut" short due to flags set to guide the search process.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DBBNode0

        DBBNode0(BoolVector r,
         int lvl)
        Sole constructor of a DBBNode0 object. Clients are not expected to create such objects which are instead created dynamically through the B&B process.
        Parameters:
        r - BoolVector // the set of (graph) node ids to be added to the nodes of the parent to represent a new partial solution
        lvl - int // the level at which this DBBNode0 object is

      • getBound

        protected double getBound()
        compute a max possible number of nodes weights this soln can have. One such bound is _nodes.sum_weights + (gsz - getForbiddenNodes().size())*max_open_node_weight/2
        Specified by:
        getBound in class DBBNodeBase
        Returns:

      • getBestNodeSets2Add

        protected java.util.Set getBestNodeSets2Add()
                                     throws ParallelException
        return Set<BoolVector> of all maximal nodesets that can be added together to the current active _nodeIds set.
        Returns:
        Set // Set<BoolVector>
        Throws:
        ParallelException - never

      • mustKeepLocally

        private static boolean mustKeepLocally()
                                throws java.io.IOException
        check whether children nodes must be sent for distribution or not, based on when the current thread sent children before. If it returns false, it also updates the time of the last distribution to now. Notice that the method also checks whether the client is currently submitting tasks (from an other thread). If so, then the method returns true so as to increase throughput.
        Returns:
        boolean
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • getBestNodes2Add

        private java.util.Set getBestNodes2Add(boolean isroot)
                                throws ParallelException
        return the Set<Node> that are best node(s) to add given the current active _nodeids set. This is the set of nodes that are free to cover, have max. weight (within the fudge factor DBBNodeBase._ff), and have the least weight of "free" NBors() (again within same fudge factor). Alternatively, if the "useGWMIN2criterion" flag is true, the "GWMIN2" heuristic criterion is utilized, so that the free nodes that are within DBBNodeBase._ff times from the maximum value of the quantity $w_n / \Sum_{v \in N^+_n}w_v$ form the return set.
        Parameters:
        isroot - boolean if true then _ff is set to zero, so that all non-forbidden nodes with min. sum of neighbors-weights are returned.
        Returns:
        Set // Set<Node>
        Throws:
        ParallelException

      • isFree2Cover

        private static boolean isFree2Cover(Node nj,
                                    java.util.Set active)
        check if node nj can be set to one when the nodes in active are also set.
        Parameters:

      • isFeas

        private boolean isFeas(java.util.Set nodes)
        check if the nodes parameter can be added to the current active set of nodes represented by this DBBNode0 object.
        Parameters:
        nodes - Set // Set<Node>
        Returns:
        boolean true iff nodes can be added to the current solution

      • isFeas

        private static boolean isFeas(BoolVector c1,
                              BoolVector c2)
        check if c1 conflicts with c2, in that there exist n1 \in c1 that is a neighbor of some n2 \in c2. Notice that the method assumes that both c1 and c2 are currently feasible, ie the calls isFeas(c1) and isFeas(c2) must return true.
        Parameters:
        c1 - BoolVector
        c2 - BoolVector
        Returns:
        boolean false iff c1 U nbors(c1) contain any of c2.
